oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Waitin' For Wakely - 1950-11-28 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: ABC DJ program Waitin' For Wakely, originally broadcast 1950-11-28, part 1. Hosted by Cottonseed Clark (filling in for Jimmy Wakely), produced by Jack Wormser, with announcer Reed Browning.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jimmy Wakely; Paul Weston; Art Morton; Rose Blane; Abe Lyman and his Californians
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Original Amateur Hour commercial (Reed Browning) -- Theme (At The Close Of A Long, Long Day) (Jimmy Wakely) (recording) -- Opening statement (Reed Browning) -- Opening statement (Cottonseed Clark) -- Watchin' The Trains Go By (Perry Como) (recording) -- Cottonseed Clark talks -- I'll Get By (Paul Weston, Art Morton) (recording) -- Cottonseed Clark talks -- Wrap Your Dreams In The Red, White And Blue (Rose Blane, Abe Lyman and his Californians) (recording) -- Cottonseed Clark talks -- I Don't Have To Die To Go To Heaven (Jimmy Wakely) (recording) -- Cottonseed Clark talks
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: American Broadcasting Company; Waitin' for Wakely (Radio program); Wakely, Jimmy, 1914-1982; Clark, Cottonseed
